pullRequest.body:
Add various miscellaneous lemmas about orbits, mainly about orbits under the subgroup / submonoid action.

From AperiodicMonotilesLean.


---

nodes.body:
I salute the intention to generalise this but I think #11304 demonstrates that a separate battle would need to be faught which I do not think need block this work.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8562245945/job/23465105491)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8562245945/job/23465105059)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8562245945/job/23465105344)
I wonder if you can use https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/Submonoid/Basic.html#SubmonoidClass to avoid having both a submonoid version and a subgroup version?

The `MulAction` instance (and a load of other related instances) only exists for `Subgroup` and `Submonoid`, not for `SubmonoidClass`, so you can't even state the lemma for `SubmonoidClass` at present.
How hard would it be to generalize those? Or would this be best left to another PR?
Maybe I'll just do it myself in a separate PR.

I think most of the subobject / hom / equiv classes probably have lots of scope to generalize existing definitions and results (including removing duplicate definitions / results for specific types if possible, which hasn't consistently been done when such generalization was done in the past). I'd expect lots more for `SubmonoidClass` than just those instances, so separate PRs definitely seem better for such generalizations.
Can you generalise this lemma to `SubmonoidClass`?
See the above resolved discussion. The `MulAction` instance doesn't exist for `SubmonoidClass`, and @tb65536's attempt to add it in #11304 ran into benchmark regressions.
I do wonder whether a more limited version of #11304 might be viable.
Can't you somehow *assume* the existence of the action?

I suppose you could have another typeclass that asserts that a `SubmonoidClass` has a `MulAction` satisfying `smul_def`. I suspect it would be less convenient in various cases than having `smul_def` true by defeq, which is what defining the action for `SubmonoidClass` achieves.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic): various orbit lemmas
